stimulusHtml: Which of the following indicates the direction, if any, of the electric field at Point P at the center of the conducting shell and provides a valid justification?

features.html: A positive point charge + q is located to the left of a hollow conducting shell, as shown in the figure. There is zero net charge on the shell.

choicesHtml: The field is zero and has no direction. The electric potential is the same everywhere inside of a conducting shell.
The field is zero and has no direction. At the center of a closed, conducting shell, the field created by uniform charge distributions on the shellâ€™s inner and outer surfaces must be zero.
The field direction is toward the right. In the nonconducting region inside a conducting shell, the field is that of any external charge or charge distribution.

The field direction is toward the right. Within a conducting shell, charge distributed on the surface of the shell reduces, but does not cancel, the field from any external charge or charge distribution.
